sentiment_score_definition: x <= -0.35: Bearish; -0.35 < x <= -0.15: Somewhat-Bearish; -0.15 < x < 0.15: Neutral; 0.15 <= x < 0.35: Somewhat_Bullish; x >= 0.35: Bullish
relevance_score_definition: 0 < x <= 1, with a higher score indicating higher relevance.

feed.title: Year-end hiring slows: ADP tracks 8,000 new jobs a week
feed.summary: ADP's NER Pulse reported that U.S. private employers added an average of 8,000 jobs per week in the four weeks ending December 27, 2025, indicating a modest slowdown in hiring towards the year-end. These preliminary figures are subject to revision and are part of a weekly series published by ADP Research in collaboration with the Stanford Digital Economy Lab. The next NER Pulse release is scheduled for January 27, 2026.

feed.title: Newmont Corp (NYSE:NEM) Emerges as a Peter Lynch-Style GARP Investment
feed.summary: Newmont Corp (NYSE:NEM) is presented as a strong "growth at a reasonable price" (GARP) investment, aligning with Peter Lynch's investment philosophy. The article highlights Newmont's durable earnings growth, sensible price-to-growth ratio, high profitability, and cautious financial structure, all of which fit Lynch's key metrics. Despite being in a traditional industry, Newmont's financial health and consistent performance make it an attractive option for long-term GARP investors.

feed.title: Home Depot’s Q4 2025 Earnings: What to Expect
feed.summary: The Home Depot, Inc. (HD) is set to release its Q4 2025 earnings on February 24, with analysts expecting a 19.2% decline in profit per share compared to the previous year. Despite a modest revenue increase in Q3 2025, profitability slipped, causing an intraday stock drop. The stock recently saw a boost from President Trump's announcement regarding mortgage bonds, and analysts currently rate HD a "Moderate Buy."

feed.title: A Glimpse Into The Expert Outlook On IBM Through 12 Analysts
feed.summary: Twelve analysts have recently provided diverse ratings for IBM, ranging from bullish to bearish, with an average 12-month price target of $311.42, an increase of 6.52% from the prior average. Several analysts raised their price targets and ratings, highlighting a generally positive sentiment. IBM, a long-standing technology company, demonstrates strong market capitalization, positive revenue growth of 9.11%, and impressive net margins alongside a high debt-to-equity ratio, indicating both financial strengths and areas of risk.

feed.title: ICE Announces 2025 Records Across Its Global Derivative and NYSE Equity & NYSE Options Markets
feed.summary: Intercontinental Exchange Inc. (NYSE: ICE) announced record-breaking achievements in 2025 across its global derivative and NYSE equity and options markets. The company reported a record 2.4 billion derivative contracts traded with a record average daily volume of 9.3 million, alongside record NYSE Equities and Options average daily volumes. These milestones highlight the strength and resilience of ICE's technology and infrastructure, which also processed over 1 trillion messages on two separate days.

feed.title: Aeva wins first defense contract to supply lidar for autonomous vehicles
feed.summary: Aeva Technologies, Inc. has secured its first defense contract, providing 4D LiDAR sensors and perception technology to Forterra for autonomous defense vehicles. This technology enhances environmental awareness and obstacle detection in challenging environments, validating Aeva's platform for demanding autonomous missions. The announcement highlights the growing adoption of advanced perception technologies within the defense sector.

feed.title: Willis Lease Finance announces $0.40 quarterly dividend
feed.summary: Willis Lease Finance Corporation has declared a quarterly dividend of $0.40 per share, payable on February 20, 2026, to shareholders recorded by February 11, 2026. This announcement highlights the company's strong business performance and commitment to shareholder value. The commercial aircraft engine lessor also recently reported Q3 2025 earnings, secured significant financing through note offerings, and made strategic leadership appointments.

feed.title: SharkNinja Appoints Kaitlin Folan as Chief Accounting Officer
feed.summary: SharkNinja (SN) has appointed Kaitlin Folan as its new Chief Accounting Officer, effective January 20, 2026. Her compensation package includes a $450,000 base salary, eligibility for an annual bonus, a $240,000 signing bonus, and $1.2 million in performance-linked equity incentives. SharkNinja's stock currently has a Buy rating from analysts with a $142.00 price target, and TipRanks' AI Analyst, Spark, rates SN as Outperform due to strong financial performance and cash generation.

feed.title: Novavax rises on licensing deal with Pfizer (NVAX:NASDAQ)
feed.summary: Novavax shares rose by about 5% after reaching a licensing deal with Pfizer. The agreement allows Pfizer to use Novavax's Matrix-M adjuvant in its pharmaceutical products. This development is significant for Novavax, a COVID-19 vaccine maker, as it expands the application of its technology.

feed.title: FRIDAY INVESTOR DEADLINE: StubHub Holdings, Inc. Investors
feed.summary: Robbins Geller Rudman & Dowd LLP announced a Friday, January 23, 2026 deadline for investors who purchased StubHub Holdings, Inc. (NYSE: STUB) stock during its September 17, 2025 IPO to seek lead plaintiff status in a class action lawsuit. The lawsuit alleges that StubHub's IPO documents were materially false and misleading regarding changes in vendor payments and their adverse impact on free cash flow, leading to a significant stock price decline. Investors who suffered substantial losses are encouraged to contact Robbins Geller to learn more about leading the class action.
